class slam.frontend_manager.element_distributor.elements_distributor.ElementDistributor[source]

Bases: object

Distributes elements from DataBatch to corresponding handlers for further processing.

property storage: MeasurementStorage

Storage of measurements.

property sensor_handler_table: dict[Sensor, list[Handler]]

“Sensor -> handlers” tables.

init_table(table_config: dict[str, list[str]]) → None[source]

Initializes “sensor -> handlers” table.

Parameters:

table_config – table with “sensor name -> handlers names” pairs.

clear_storage(data: Iterable[OrderedSet[Measurement]]) → None[source]

Removes the given data from the measurements storage.

Parameters:

data – data to be removed from storage.

Distributes the element to the handler for further processing.

slam.frontend_manager.element_distributor.measurement_storage module

class slam.frontend_manager.element_distributor.measurement_storage.Measurement(time_range: TimeRange, values: Any, handler: Handler, elements: tuple[Element, ...], noise_covariance: tuple[float, ...])[source]

Bases: object

A measurement formed of processed element(s) by the corresponding handler.

Hash calculation ignores “values” attribute because not all values are hashable.

time_range: TimeRange
values: Any
handler: Handler
elements: tuple[Element, ...]
noise_covariance: tuple[float, ...]
class slam.frontend_manager.element_distributor.measurement_storage.MeasurementStorage[source]

Bases: object

Storage for measurements.

property data: dict[Handler, OrderedSet[Measurement]]

Dictionary with “handler -> measurements” pairs.

property recent_measurement: Measurement

A measurement with latest “stop” timestamp in the storage.

Raises:

IndexError – if the storage is empty.

property time_range: TimeRange

Start & stop time margins to cover all measurements in the storage.

Raises:

IndexError – time range does not exists for empty storage.

property empty: bool

Checks if the storage is empty.

add(measurement: Measurement) → None[source]
add(data: dict[Handler, OrderedSet[Measurement]]) → None

Adds new measurement to the storage.

Parameters:

measurement – the measurement to add.

add(self, data: dict[slam.frontend_manager.handlers.ABC_handler.Handler, slam.utils.ordered_set.OrderedSet[slam.frontend_manager.element_distributor.measurement_storage.Measurement]]) → NoneType[source]

@overload.

Adds multiple measurements to the storage in “handler -> measurements” table format.

Attention

might be slow due to the “recent_measurement” update.

Parameters:

data – measurements to add.

remove(measurement: Measurement) → None[source]

Removes the measurement from the storage.

Parameters:

measurement – the measurement to remove.

clear() → None[source]

Clears the storage.

_update_state() → tuple[TimeRange, Measurement][source]

Updates the time range of the storage.

TODO: the time range might be updated quicker then O(N).

Returns:

time range, recent measurement with latest “stop” timestamp.
